title: test_ci_generate_with_env fails when run on its own

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
Refers to the comment in the "Error message" of #17479  When running:
```
$ spack test lib/spack/spack/test/cmd/ci.py::test_ci_generate_with_env
```
the test fails. This does not happen when running the test as part of the test suite.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack test lib/spack/spack/test/cmd/ci.py::test_ci_generate_with_env
=================================================================== test session starts ====================================================================
platform linux -- Python 3.7.4, pytest-3.2.5, py-1.4.34, pluggy-0.4.0
rootdir: /home/culpo/PycharmProjects/spack, inifile: pytest.ini
collected 1 item                                                                                                                                            

lib/spack/spack/test/cmd/ci.py F
================================================================= short test summary info ==================================================================
FAIL lib/spack/spack/test/cmd/ci.py::test_ci_generate_with_env

================================================================ slowest 20 test durations =================================================================
0.35s call     lib/spack/spack/test/cmd/ci.py::test_ci_generate_with_env
0.03s setup    lib/spack/spack/test/cmd/ci.py::test_ci_generate_with_env
0.00s teardown lib/spack/spack/test/cmd/ci.py::test_ci_generate_with_env
========================================================================= FAILURES =========================================================================
________________________________________________________________ test_ci_generate_with_env _________________________________________________________________

tmpdir = local('/tmp/pytest-of-culpo/pytest-24/test_ci_generate_with_env0'), mutable_mock_env_path = local('/tmp/pytest-of-culpo/pytest-24/mock-env-path0')
env_deactivate = None, install_mockery = None, mock_packages = <spack.repo.RepoPath object at 0x7f85b4b2d310>

    def test_ci_generate_with_env(tmpdir, mutable_mock_env_path, env_deactivate,
                                  install_mockery, mock_packages):
        """Make sure we can get a .gitlab-ci.yml from an environment file
           which has the gitlab-ci, cdash, and mirrors sections."""
        filename = str(tmpdir.join('spack.yaml'))
        with open(filename, 'w') as f:
            f.write("""\
    spack:
      definitions:
        - bootstrap:
          - cmake@3.4.3
        - old-gcc-pkgs:
          - archive-files
          - callpath
          - hypre@0.2.15
      specs:
        - matrix:
          - [$old-gcc-pkgs]
      mirrors:
        some-mirror: https://my.fake.mirror
      gitlab-ci:
        bootstrap:
          - name: bootstrap
            compiler-agnostic: true
        mappings:
          - match:
              - arch=test-debian6-x86_64
            runner-attributes:
              tags:
                - donotcare
              image: donotcare
        final-stage-rebuild-index:
          image: donotcare
          tags: [donotcare]
      cdash:
        build-group: Not important
        url: https://my.fake.cdash
        project: Not used
        site: Nothing
    """)
        with tmpdir.as_cwd():
            env_cmd('create', 'test', './spack.yaml')
            outputfile = str(tmpdir.join('.gitlab-ci.yml'))
    
            with ev.read('test'):
>               ci_cmd('generate', '--output-file', outputfile)

lib/spack/spack/test/cmd/ci.py:161: 
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 
lib/spack/spack/main.py:545: in __call__
    self.command, self.parser, args, unknown)
lib/spack/spack/main.py:489: in _invoke_command
    return_val = command(parser, args)
lib/spack/spack/cmd/ci.py:394: in ci
    args.func(args)
lib/spack/spack/cmd/ci.py:102: in ci_generate
    use_dependencies=use_dependencies)
lib/spack/spack/ci.py:457: in generate_gitlab_ci_yaml
    env.concretize()
lib/spack/spack/environment.py:968: in concretize
    return self._concretize_separately()
lib/spack/spack/environment.py:1036: in _concretize_separately
    concrete = _concretize_from_constraints(uspec_constraints)
lib/spack/spack/environment.py:1622: in _concretize_from_constraints
    return s.concretized()
lib/spack/spack/spec.py:2323: in concretized
    clone.concretize()
lib/spack/spack/spec.py:2170: in concretize
    self._expand_virtual_packages(concretizer),
lib/spack/spack/spec.py:2075: in _expand_virtual_packages
    candidates = concretizer.choose_virtual_or_external(spec)
lib/spack/spack/concretize.py:120: in choose_virtual_or_external
    candidates = self._valid_virtuals_and_externals(spec)
lib/spack/spack/concretize.py:94: in _valid_virtuals_and_externals
    if is_spec_buildable(cspec):
lib/spack/spack/package_prefs.py:202: in is_spec_buildable
    any(spec.package.provides(name) for name in reverse))
lib/spack/spack/package_prefs.py:202: in <genexpr>
    any(spec.package.provides(name) for name in reverse))
lib/spack/spack/spec.py:1175: in package
    self._package = spack.repo.get(self)
lib/spack/spack/repo.py:1190: in get
    return path.get(spec)
lib/spack/spack/repo.py:90: in converter
    return function(self, spec_like, *args, **kwargs)
lib/spack/spack/repo.py:650: in get
    return self.repo_for_pkg(spec).get(spec)
lib/spack/spack/repo.py:90: in converter
    return function(self, spec_like, *args, **kwargs)
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 

self = [Repo 'builtin.mock' at '/home/culpo/PycharmProjects/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin.mock'], spec = intel-parallel-studio

    @autospec
    def get(self, spec):
        """Returns the package associated with the supplied spec."""
        if not self.exists(spec.name):
>           raise UnknownPackageError(spec.name)
E           spack.repo.UnknownPackageError: Package 'intel-parallel-studio' not found.

lib/spack/spack/repo.py:882: UnknownPackageError
================================================================= 1 failed in 0.90 seconds =================================================================
```

### Error Message

The error message is reported above.

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.15.1-107-9c42f246e
* **Python:** 3.7.4
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell

### Additional information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands ~in debug mode~ and reported the output
